page.title: 05KNUTSFORD INFORMATION CENTRE
page.content: About five hundred people visit the information centre each week in peak season. They come to the information centre for various reasons. Tourists generally ask for accommodation and directions, whereas the citizens of Knutsford generally ask for advice on things such as blocked drains. More tourists come to the town when special events take place such as the Knutsford Royal May Day and the Cheshire Show. They are also very interested in Historic Knutsford as many famous people have been connected with the town. Some examples of these people are Elizabeth Gaskell, Highwayman Higgins and Richard Harding Watt whose architecture can still be seen in parts of Knutsford. Americans, Canadians, French, German and English are just some of the people who go to the information centre each week.
